intro: Gompholobium asperulum, commonly known as the rough gompholobium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Gompholobium asperulum is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to thrive in harsh environments.
